meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a college.
meanings.sent1: The collegiate atmosphere on campus was friendly and welcoming.
meanings.sent2: She wore a collegiate sweater with her school's logo on it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to adopt a collegiate style by hanging out near the library.
meanings.sent4: Her room was decorated in a collegiate theme, with pennants and posters.
meanings.sent5: The collegiate colors of blue and white adorned the school banners.

meanings.definition: Involving or intended for college students.
meanings.sent1: The collegiate event was a fun mixer for students to socialize.
meanings.sent2: He attended a collegiate conference to learn more about his field of study.
meanings.sent3: The professor's attempt at a joke about collegiate life fell flat in class.
meanings.sent4: The collegiate party was a night to remember for all the students.
meanings.sent5: The collegiate bookstore was bustling with students buying textbooks.

meanings.definition: Member of a college or university.
meanings.sent1: As a collegiate, she was involved in many campus activities.
meanings.sent2: The collegiates gathered in the quad for a group photo.
meanings.sent3: The group of collegiates decided to start a study group for finals.
meanings.sent4: The collegiates cheered loudly at the football game.
meanings.sent5: The new collegiate was eager to explore all the clubs on campus.
